channel.title: Members of MSCP, what's your job?
channel.description:
It'll be interesting to see where people work or what they're studying. We have a huge collection of different personalities here so I'm expecting them to vary..
Shoot.

item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Also work quite high up at the local large pharmacy. Oh and I’m doing a degree in web technology two days a week in there somewhere too

item.description:

wow nice they don’t just give those out to anybody o.o

You know with a clearance like that you can literally do any federal related IT job out there. And federal jobs… now those are the ones you want to have!

item.title: Members of MSCP, what's your job?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Cruel Truth:

[quote]ethical hacking

I just got a good laugh thanks heh

and yeah I guess I didn’t think about the factor that being in the military does lessen the amount you have to pay in student loans and etc. Don’t you still have to serve for so long or something?[/quote]

Yeah I have a 6 year active duty enlistment. I’m trying to switch to reserve at the 3 year mark though. And yeah, ethical hacking does sound kind of stupid but it doesn’t look bad on a resume.

I forgot to mention they also gave me a top secret clearance. Google the cost for that investigation, it isn’t cheap lol.

Read full topic

[/quote]

item.source: Members of MSCP, what's your job?

item.title: Members of MSCP, what's your job?
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“LilXCj, post:42, topic:482010”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=600248.msg4216694#msg4216694 date=1360363199]

Undergrad Computer Sci. Major @ Winthrop Uni w/ a Mathematics minor (I could take one more semester and just get two degrees but money issues).

Freshman Cross Country and Track runner.

A little update for you guys regarding running:
I am the #1 freshman in the 800m for indoor track in my conference (Big South) with just a 2:03 SB. Hoping to run sub 1:57 by conference.

EDIT:
Dream goal is to attend 2016 Olympics. I want to be running sub-1:45 in the 800m by then.

Damn right you’re gonna run a sub 1:57 by conf. Didn’t you hit 1:58 your senior yr of hs?
[/quote]
Officially, yes. I’ve run a 1:57 in a meet that wasn’t registered by SC Runners.[/quote]My friend also ran a 1:57 his senior year last spring. Not sure if he’s doing track this year though since he has an academic/soccer scholarship.

Read full topic
item.source: Members of MSCP, what's your job?

item.title: Members of MSCP, what's your job?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“Cruel Truth, post:48, topic:482010”]30k for only a network administrator? I’m sorry but your getting ripped off. (true though there are some freaking epic insurance benefits with all branches of the military I suppose)

After doing a quick search on www.monster.com I can say with confidence that 30k is something to honestly laugh at with the specifications most people look for (network certifications and etc). Most out where I live make easily 40-50k as a junior admin and about 55-80k as a senior one.[/quote]

I’m not getting ripped off. I know what the pay is in the civilian sector and I plan on getting out when my enlistment is over so I can pursue a career in IT. But if I hadn’t joined the military I wouldn’t have learned the skills required to make that much money and I wouldn’t be given the oppurtunities to learn and advance myself so quickly. In fact I’d still be at home working at subway for $7.65/hr.

You might not see the benefits but to alot of people this is there only oppurtunity to get ahead in life.

Oh and did I mention how awesome my job is? When I’m done with tech school I get to move to Northern California (fucking awesome) and work on the servers that handle pictures taken by our unmanned drones.

One last thing about the educational oppurtunities. I’m taking my Sec+ exam in < 2 weeks. When I get to my first duty station I can sign up for training for CISSP, CCNA, Linux+, and Ethical Hacking among others. They will pay for all the classes and then they will pay for me to take the tests. From my standpoint thats pretty fucking awesome!

Read full topic

item.title: Members of MSCP, what's your job?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

EMINEM BEAST™:

I’m currently working at my local butcher shop… But once I graduate from high school I plan on joining the Air Force.

If you have any questions at all about your oppurtunites, job choice, daily life in the enlisted ranks, or anything at all feel free to message me!

[quote=“Cruel Truth, post:8, topic:482010”][quote author=Newty link=topic=600248.msg4216322#msg4216322 date=1360319262]
Network administrator for the usaf
[/quote]that’s sweet as hell. Are you like a junior level or what? What’s the general pay for a governmental network administrator range from?[/quote]

I’m enlisted in the Air Force, I wish I was a contractor (thinking about doing it when my enlistment is over :D)

You can look my pay up if you want, its all publically available. I’ll be in E-3 in two weeks and I’m married so my pay works out to be roughly ~30k a year before taxes etc. Not exactly rich but all my bills are paid and I’m getting free college and amazing job experience and awesome industry certifications!

Read full topic
